string_table.name: npnxnanbnsnfns00000100101
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: Untitled Scene
EMU TRAINSET - BOGIE
Assessments Landing Page

Drag and drop the wheel position number for each wheel in the allocated box, taking into account the orientation of the car, to show the position number of each wheel in the illustration below. Please note that the numbers on the left should be used for the left wheels only, and the numbers on the right should be used for the M2 wheels only.
How many wheels are on a 6 car trainset?
Each wheelset has an identification number attached to each wheelset axle box.
1. Car floor height from top of rail = mm
Two-coat epoxy paint system is applied on the bogie frames to protect against corrosion.
What is the difference between the TB and MB frames?
What is the purpose of the oil injection port drilled through the wheel hub?
Give a full name for (WSP System) and its basic functionality
On which car/s and which bogie/s is the life /stone guard positioned?
What is the primary suspension made of?
The conical springs are letter-coded according to their stiffness tolerances.
What is the main function of the secondary suspension?
Select 3 components of the Car-Stabilising subsystem.
How many vertical dampers are there per bogie?
What is the purpose of the anti-roll bar and how much angle does it allow movement?
What limits the lateral movement of the car-body on the bogie?
Each traction motor is mounted directly onto the axle.
How many traction motors are there in one EMU-trainset?
Select two components that the coupling connects.
On which car/s are the TBs and MBs located on a 6 car trainset? (Illustrate the car type and bogie type in the picture below as given in example).

Drag and drop the wheel position number for each wheel in the allocated box, taking into account the orientation of the car, to show the position number of each wheel in the illustration below. Please note that the numbers on the left should be used for the left wheels only, and the numbers on the right should be used for the M2 wheels only.
How many TBEXT and TBINT bogies are present on a 6 car trainset?
What is the difference between the MB1 and MB2?
1. Bogie wheel base (axle to axle) = mm
The trailer bogies have 1 gearbox each compared to the motor bogies which have 2 gearboxes each.
What is the difference between the TBEXT and TBINT bogies?
There are 2 locations on a bogie, be it a motor bogie or a trailer bogie, where a speed sensor may be mounted. Choose 2 locations on a bogie.
How many axles on a 6 car trainset are not monitored for speed?
How many axles on a 6 car trainset are not monitored for speed?
What is the function of the vertical dampers?
How many centre-pivot connections are there per bogie?
What is the purpose of the coupling?
How many brake calipers are mounted per bogie?
How many park brake release handles are present per car?
What is the purpose of the anti-roll bar and how much angle does it allow movement?
What is the WSP system and what controls it?
How many ERTMS speed sensors are mounted on a 6 car trainset and on which car/s are they mounted?
The motor conducts regenerative braking, rheostatic braking or both?
The oil injection port on the wheel is used to mount the wheel onto the axle.
Each traction motor is mounted directly onto the axle.
How many MB1 and MB2 are present on a 6 car trainset?
What is the difference between the TBEXT and TBINT?
1. Bogie wheel base (axle to axle) = mm
LEARNING OBJECTIVES
1 INTRODUCTION
2 PRODUCT DESCRIPTION
3 SAFETY NOTE
4 PERFORMANCES
5 STANDARDS
Activity landing page
The bogies are identifiable via a name plate located on the underside of the car the bogie is mounted onto.
What is the purpose of the secondary suspension?
The traction motor runs on?
How many axles on a 6 car trainset are not monitored for speed?
Two-coat epoxy paint system is applied on the bogie frames to protect against corrosion.
The bogies are identifiable via a name plate located on the underside of the car the bogie is mounted onto.
What is the difference between the TB and MB wheelsets? Please select two answers.
There are 4 types of axle box covers/end equipment. Please select four answers.
Which bogie on a 6 car trainset does not have a speed sensor mounted on the axle box or motor?
On which car and which bogie is the life guard/stone guard positioned? Please select two answers.
What is the function of the Earth/Current Return Unit?
What is the primary suspension made of?
What is the purpose of the lifting eye/stop ring?
What is the purpose of the secondary suspension?
What is the purpose of the damper/s?
What is the purpose of the anti-roll bar and how much angle does it allow movement?
What connects the bogie to the car and how many connections per bogie?
Does the traction motor run on DC or AC voltage?
The motor conducts regenerative braking, rheostatic braking or both?
Each traction motor is mounted with a speed sensor.
Each traction motor is mounted directly onto the axle.
